Scope

This Law stipulates that officials;obligations of officials;recruiting, using and managing officials in public non -business units.

Officials

Officials who are Vietnamese citizens are recruited according to their job positions, working at public non -business units according to the working contract regime, paying salaries from the salary fund of public non -business units in accordance with Francethe law.

Explain words

In this law, the words below are understood as follows:

1. Management officials are the appointed persons holding the position of a definite manager, responsible for executing, organizing the implementation of one or a number of jobs in public non -business units but not civil servants and not as civil servants andEnjoy management positions.

2. Professional ethics are standards of awareness and behavior in accordance with the characteristics of each field of professional activities prescribed by competent agencies and organizations.

3. Conducting rules are the behavioral standards of officials in performing tasks and in social relations issued by competent state agencies, in accordance with the work characteristics in each field of activity.and are made public for the people to supervise the observance.

4. Recruitment is the selection of people with quality, qualifications and capacity to be an official in public non -business units.

5. Working contract is a written agreement between officials or the recruited person as an official and the head of a public non -business unit on the job position, salary, remuneration, conditionswork rights and obligations of each party.

Occupational activities of officials

Occupational activities of officials are the performance of jobs or tasks that require qualifications, capacity, professional skills and professional skills in public non -business units in accordance with this Law and regulations and regulations.other relevant laws.

Principles in professional activities of officials

1. Compliance with the law, take responsibility before the law in the process of performing professional activities.

2. Dedication to serve the people.

3. Compliance with the processes, professional regulations, professional ethics and the Code of Conduct.

4. To be subject to inspection, examination and supervision of competent agencies and organizations of the people.

Principles of public employee management

1. Ensuring the leadership of the Communist Party of Vietnam and the unification of the State's management.

2. Ensuring the initiative and upholding the responsibility of the head of the public non -business unit.

3. The recruitment, use, management and evaluation of officials are carried out on the basis of criteria for professional titles, job positions and based on working contracts.

4. Implementing gender equality, the State's preferential policies for officials who are talented, ethnic minority people, people with meritorious services to the revolution, officials working in the mountains, borders,Islands, remote areas, ethnic minority areas, areas with extremely difficult socio -economic conditions and other preferential policies of the State for officials.

Job position

1. Job position is a job or task associated with the corresponding professional title or management position, is the basis for determining the number of people working and structure of officials to perform the recruitment and use.and manage officials in public non -business units.

2. The Government stipulates the principles and methods of determining the job position, authority, order and procedures for deciding the number of job positions in public non -business units.

Career titles

1. Career title is the name that shows the qualifications and professional capacity of officials in each professional field.

2. The Ministry of the Interior shall assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with relevant ministries and agencies, which stipulate the list of lists, standards and professional titles.

Public non -business units and organizational structure of operational management of public non -business units

1. Public non -business units are organizations organized by the competent authorities of the State, political organizations, socio -political organizations in accordance with the law, with legal status, and provision.Public services, serving state management.

2. Public non -business units include:

a) The public non -business unit is assigned to fully autonomy on the performance of tasks, finance, organizational structure and personnel (hereinafter referred to as public non -business units that are assigned autonomy);

b) The public non -business unit has not been assigned the autonomy completely on the performance of tasks, finance, organizational structure and personnel (hereinafter referred to as public non -business units that have not been assigned autonomy).

3. The Government details the criteria for classification of public non -business units prescribed in Clause 2 of this Article for each field of non -business based on the ability to autonomy in performing tasks, finance and organizationsapparatus, personnel and scope of activities of public non -business units.

4. Based on specific conditions, management requirements for each type of public non -business unit in each field, the Government stipulates the establishment, structure of functions, tasks and powers of the CouncilManagement in public non -business units, the relationship between the Management Council and the head of the public non -business unit.

Policy to build and develop public non -business units and officials

1. The State focuses on building a system of public non -business units to provide public services that the State must be responsible mainly to serve the people in the field of health, education and department.Study and other fields that non -public sectors are not able to meet;Ensuring the provision of basic health and education services in mountainous areas, borders and islands in remote areas, ethnic minority areas, areas with extremely difficult socio -economic conditions.

2. The Government coordinates with competent agencies to direct the planning, organization, rearrangement of a system of public non -business units in the direction of determining limited areas and fields to focus on favorable concentration.The first development, ensuring economical and efficient use, focusing resources to improve the quality of non -business activities.Not organizing public non -business units only perform business services and profits.

3. Continuing to renovate the operating mechanism of public non -business units in the direction of autonomy, self -responsibility, and independent accounting;Separation of state management functions of ministries and ministerial -level agencies with the function of managing public non -business units.

4. The State has policies to build and develop a contingent of professional ethics, qualified and professional capacity to meet the increasing requirements of the public service provider;Detecting, attracting, fostering, respecting and treating worthy of talented people to improve the quality of serving the people.

The rights of the officials about professional activities

1. To be protected by law in professional activities.

2. Trained and fostered to improve political, professional and professional levels.

3. To ensure equipment, equipment and working conditions.

4. Provided information related to work or assigned tasks.

5. To decide the professional issue associated with the assigned work or task.

6. Being allowed to refuse to perform work or duties contrary to the provisions of law.

7. Enjoy other professional activities in accordance with the law.

The right of the officer about the salary and the regimes related to the salary

1. To be paid in commensurate with the job position, professional title, management position and the results of the assigned work or tasks;Enjoy preferential allowances and policies in case of working in mountainous areas, borders, islands, remote areas, ethnic minority areas, areas with extremely difficult socio -economic conditions orWorking in industries has a toxic, dangerous environment, specific career field.

2. Enjoying overtime, night work, dolls and other regimes as prescribed by law and regulations of public non -business units.

3. Enjoy bonuses, consider raising salaries in accordance with the law and regulations of public non -business units.

The right of the officer about rest

1. Annual leave, holiday, separate leave in accordance with the law on labor.Due to work requirements, officials who do not use or use without all the annual days of holidays are paid a sum of money for the days of not breaking.

2. Officials working in mountainous areas, borders, islands, remote areas or other special cases, if required, are combined with the number of days of leave for 2 years to leave once;If the number of days of leave for 03 years to leave once, it must be agreed by the head of the public non -business unit.

3. For specific career fields, officials are allowed to quit their jobs and receive salaries in accordance with the law.

4. Get off without salary in case of good reasons and the consent of the head of the public non -business unit.

Officials' rights on business activities and work outside the prescribed time

1. Career activities outside the working time prescribed in the working contract, unless otherwise provided for by law.

2. To sign a contract, work with other agencies, organizations and units that the law does not prohibit but must complete the assigned tasks and have the consent of the head of the public non -business unit.

3. Capital contribution but not participating in management and administration of limited liability companies, joint stock companies, partnerships, cooperatives, private hospitals, private schools and private scientific research organization, except for other specialized laws.

Other rights of officials

Officials are rewarded, honored and participated in socio -economic activities;enjoy preferential policies on housing;facilitated to learn professional activities in the country and abroad as prescribed by law.In case of injury or death due to work or assigned tasks, they are considered to be considered as wounded or considered as martyrs as prescribed by law.

General obligations of officials

1. Observe the guidelines, guidelines and policies of the Communist Party of Vietnam and the State's laws.

2. Having a healthy, honest, needed, economical, integrity, and impartial lifestyle.

3. Having a sense of discipline and responsibility in professional activities;strictly comply with the regulations, rules and working regulations of public non -business units.

4. Protection of state secrets;preserving and protecting the public, using the effective use of assets.

5. Cultivating and practicing professional ethics, implementing the Code of Conduct of Officials.

Obligations of officials in professional activities

1. Perform the work or assigned tasks to ensure time and quality requirements.

2. Coordinate well with colleagues in performing jobs or tasks.

3. Observe the assignment of the work of the competent person.

4. Regular learning to improve the qualifications, professional skills.

5. When serving the people, officials must comply with the following provisions:

a) Having a polite attitude and respect for the people;

b) Having a spirit of cooperation and modest manner;

c) Not bossy, door rights, causing difficulties and troubles to the people;

d) Observe the regulations on professional ethics.

6. Responsible for the implementation of professional activities.

7. Perform other obligations as prescribed by law.

What officials are not done

1. Evading responsibility, quitting work or assigned tasks;causing sects, loss of solidarity;voluntary resignation;join the public family.

2. Using assets of agencies, organizations, units and people contrary to the provisions of law.

3. Distinguishing nation, men and women, social composition, beliefs and religions in any form.

4. Taking advantage of professional activities to propagate against the guidelines and policies of the Party, the laws of the State or cause harm to Thuan Phong, American customs, cultural and spiritual life of the people.and society.

5. insulting the honor, dignity and reputation of others while carrying out professional activities.

6. Other officials must not do according to the provisions of the Law on Anti -Corruption, the Law on thrift practice, waste combat and other relevant law provisions.

Recruitment Base

The recruitment of officials must base on the needs of work, job positions, professional titles and salary funds of public non -business units.

Recruitment principles

1. Ensuring publicity, transparency, fairness, objectivity and law.

2. Ensuring competitiveness.

3. Selection of the right person to meet the requirements of the job position.

4. Promoting the responsibility of the head of the public non -business unit.

5. Priority is given to people with talent, people with meritorious services to the revolution and ethnic minorities.

Recruitment method

The recruitment of officials is conducted through examination or admission.

Organize recruitment

1. For public non -business units assigned autonomy, head of public non -business units to recruit officials and take responsibility for their decisions.

For public non -business units that have not been assigned autonomy, competent agencies manage public non -business units to recruit officials or decentralize to the heads of public non -business units for implementation.Recruitment.

2. Based on the recruitment results, the head of the public non -business unit signs a contract with the successful person.

3. The Government details the contents related to the recruitment of officials prescribed in this Law.

Types of work contracts

1. Definite working contract is a contract in which the two parties determine the term and time of termination of the contract validity for a period of 12 months to 36 months.The working contract is determined for the time limit applicable to the successful person to the officials, except for the case specified at Points d and dd, Clause 1, Article 58 of this Law.

2. The unknown working contract is a contract in which the two parties do not definite the term and time of termination of the contract validity.The non -determined working contract applies to the case of a definite term and cases where cadres and civil servants transferred officials as prescribed at Point d and dd, Clause 1Article 58 of this Law.

Practice mode

1. The successful employee must perform the apprenticeship regime, except for cases where there is a time of 12 months or more to perform professional skills in accordance with the requirements of the recruitment position.

2. Practice time from 03 months to 12 months and must be specified in the working contract.

3. The Government details the apprenticeship regime.

Content changes, continued signing, temporary postponement and termination of work contracts

1. In the course of working contracts, if one party requires changing the content of the work contract, it must be notified to the other party at least 03 working days in advance.Once approved, the parties shall amend and supplement the relevant content of the working contract.During the agreement, the parties still have to follow the signed working contract.In case of failure, the parties continue to perform the signed working contract or agree to terminate the working contract.

2. For a definite term working contract, before the expiry of the 60 -day working contract, the head of the public non -business unit is based on the needs of the unit, on the basis of assessing the ability to refund.into the duty of officials, the decision to sign or terminate the working contract for officials.

3. The postponement of working contracts, termination of working contracts shall comply with the provisions of the labor law.

4. When officials transfer their work to other agencies, organizations and units, they will terminate their work contracts and settle regimes and policies as prescribed by law.

5. When officials are appointed by competent authorities to hold the positions prescribed by law as civil servants at public non -business units or make a retirement decision, the working contract will naturally terminate.

Resolve disputes over work contracts

Disputes related to the signing, implementation or termination of working contracts are resolved in accordance with the law on labor.

Appointment and change of career titles

1. The appointment of career titles for officials is implemented in accordance with the following principles:

a) Working in any job position, it is appointed to the career title corresponding to that position;

b) If the person who is appointed career title must have the criteria of that career title.

2. The change of career titles for officials is carried out through the exam or according to the principle of equality, publicity, transparency, objectivity and law.

3. Officials shall be registered or examined for professional titles if public non -business units have needs and eligible conditions and standards as prescribed by law.

4. The Government specifies the process, procedures for examination or consideration and appointment of professional titles of officials, assigning and decentralizing the organization of the exam or consideration and appointment of professional titles of officials.

Ministries and ministerial -level agencies assigned to state state management in the fields of activities of the officer in charge and coordinate with the Ministry of Home Affairs specifying the criteria for professional titles;Conditions for testing or examining professional titles of officials.

Change job position

1. When public non -business units are in need, officials may be transferred to a new job position if they meet the professional and professional standards of the job position.

2. The selection of officials to the job position is missing due to the head of public non -business units or competent agencies managing public non -business units in accordance with the principle of equality, publicity and MinhWhite, objective and lawful.

3. When moving to the new job position, the amendment and supplement of the contents of the work contract or the change of professional titles shall comply with the provisions of Clause 1, Article 28 and Article 31 of this Law.

Training and retraining regime

1. The training and retraining is carried out for officials before appointing the position of managing and changing professional titles or in order to supplement and update knowledge and skills for occupational activities.

2. Content, programs, forms, time of training and retraining officials must base on the standards of management positions, career titles, additional requirements, updates of knowledge and service skillsOccupational activities.

3. Forms of training and retraining officials include:

a) Training and retraining according to management standards;

b) Fostering according to professional titles;

c) Fostering in order to supplement and update knowledge and skills for occupational activities.

4. The ministries and ministerial -level agencies are assigned to manage the state in the fields of activities of officials in detail the content, programs, forms, time of training and retraining of officials working inbranches and fields assigned to manage.

Responsibility for training and retraining officials

1. Public non -business units are responsible for formulating and organizing the implementation of training and retraining plans for officials.

2. Public non -business units are responsible for creating conditions for officials to participate in training and retraining.

3. Funds for training and retraining officials shall be guaranteed by officials and financial resources of public non -business units and other sources.

Responsibilities and interests of officials in training and retraining

1. Officials participating in training and retraining must strictly abide by the Regulation on training and retraining and under the management of training and retraining institutions.

2. Officials are sent to participate in training and retraining entitled to salaries and allowances in accordance with the law and regulations of public non -business units;The training and retraining time is calculated as a continuous working time, which is considered to raise the salary.

3. Officials are sent to training by public non -business units if they unilaterally terminate their work contracts or arbitrarily quit compensation for training expenses according to the Government's regulations.

Secondary

1. The secondary sect is the official of this public non -business unit sent to work at agencies, organizations and other units according to the requirements of the task within a certain period of time.The head of a public non -business unit or competent agency manages public non -business units to decide the secondary office.

2. The time limit for the appointment shall not exceed 03 years, except for a number of branches and fields prescribed by the Government.

3. The assigned officials must be subject to the assignment and management of agencies, organizations and units where they are sent.

4. In the secondary period of time, the public non -business unit of the secondary official is responsible for ensuring the salary and other benefits of the officials.

.Government's determination.

6. Out of the secondary period, the officer returns to the old unit.The head of the public non -business unit elected seconded officials is responsible for receiving and arranging jobs for officials with the expiry of the second -time time to suit the professional and professional skills of the officials.

7. Do not perform the second female office of pregnant women or raise children under 36 months of age.

Appointment of management officials

1. The appointment of management officials must be based on the needs of public non -business units, criteria and conditions of the management position and in accordance with their competence, order and procedures.

2. Based on the specific conditions of the public non -business unit, officials holding the appointed manager position are not exceeding 05 years.During the time of management, officials are entitled to management positions;Participated in the occupational career title has been appointed.

3. When an official manage the time limit for holding the management position, it is necessary to consider appointing or not re -appointment.In case of not being re -appointed, the appointment authority is responsible for arranging officials into the job position according to the working needs, in accordance with the professional and professional skills of the officials.

4. Management officers are arranged to another job position or appointed a new management position, of course, holding the position of manager in charge, unless the case is assigned concurrently.

5. The authority to appoint officials holds the position of management shall be decided by the head of the public non -business unit or request the competent authority to decide on management decentralization.

6. The Government details this.

Purpose of official evaluation

The purpose of official evaluation as a basis for continues to arrange, use, appoint, dismiss, train, foster, reward, discipline and implement regimes and policies for officials.

Pursuant to official assessment

The assessment of officials is made based on the following bases:

1. The commitments in the signed working contract;

2. Regulations on professional ethics, rules of the country of officials.

Responsibility to evaluate officials

1. The head of a public non -business unit is responsible for organizing the assessment of officials under its management.

2. Based on specific conditions, the head of the public non -business unit shall assess or assign and decentralize the assessment of officials under its management.The person assigned to assess officials must be responsible to the head of the public non -business unit for the evaluation results.

3. The person competent to appoint is responsible for evaluating managers in public non -business units.

4. The Government details the order and procedures for assessing officials specified in this Article.

Notice the results of evaluation and classification of public employees

1. Content of public employees evaluation must be notified to officials.

2. The sorting results of public employees are publicized in public non -business units.

3. If it is not agreed with the evaluation and classification results, the officer is entitled to complain to the competent authority.

Pension regime

1. Officials are entitled to retirement regime in accordance with the law on labor and the law on social insurance.

2. Before 06 months, up to the day of retirement officials, agencies, organizations and management units must notify in writing the time of retirement;Before 03 months, up to the day the retired officials, agencies, organizations and management units issued a retirement decision.

3. Public non -business units may sign a contract and work with a retirement beneficiary if the unit needs and beneficiaries of the desired retirement regime;During the contract period, in addition to the remuneration under the contract, that person is entitled to a number of specific regimes and policies on management mechanism to ensure conditions for professional activities prescribed by the Government.

Complaints and settlement of complaints for decisions related to officials management

The complaint and settlement of officials' complaints for decisions of the head of public non -business units or competent authorities related to the management of public employees shall comply with the provisions of law.

Check, inspect

1. Agencies competent to manage public non -business units inspect and examine the recruitment, use and management of officials at public non -business units assigned to manage.

2. The Ministry of Home Affairs shall inspect the recruitment, use and management of officials in accordance with this Law and other relevant laws.

3. The ministries and agencies of the ministerial -level inspection of the professional activities of officials and fields are assigned to be managed.

Bonus

1. Officials with meritorious services, achievements and dedication in their work and occupational activities shall be rewarded and honored according to the provisions of law on emulation and commendation.

2. Officials are rewarded for their merits and special achievements, which are considered for salary raising ahead of time and outstanding salary raising as prescribed by the Government.

Statute, Duration of discipline

1. The statute of limitations for disciplinary treatment is the term because this law is prescribed that, when the time limit expires, officials who violate the violation are not disciplined.The statute of limitations for disciplinary action is 24 months from the time of violations.

2. The time limit for disciplinary action against officials is the time from the detection of violations of officials to the disciplinary decision of the competent authority.

Deadline for disciplinary measures shall not exceed 02 months;In case the case has complicated circumstances, it takes time for inspection and examination to verify more, the time limit for disciplinary treatment may last but not more than 04 months.

3. In case the officials have been prosecuted, prosecuted or has decided to make trial according to the criminal proceedings, but then there is a decision to suspend the investigation or suspension of the case and the violation.showing signs of disciplinary violations shall be considered for disciplinary action;Within 03 working days from the date of issuance of the decision to suspend the investigation, suspend the case, the decision maker must send the relevant decisions and documents to the official management unit for treatment.discipline.

Temporarily suspend the work

1. During the time limit for disciplinary action, the head of a public non -business unit decided to suspend the work of an official if the official continued to work, which could make it difficult for the consideration and handlingthe law.The temporary suspension time does not exceed 15 days, the necessary case may last for more than 30 days.Out of time to suspend the work, if the official is not disciplined, it is arranged in the old job position.

2. During the temporary suspension of work, officials are entitled to salary in accordance with the Government's regulations.

Responsibility for compensation, refund

1. Officials lost and damaged equipment, equipment or other acts that cause property damage of public non -business units must pay damages.

2. Official officers who perform the work or task assigned to have faulty cause damage to others that public non -business units must pay compensation, the obligation to return to the public non -business unit.

The Government details the determination of the official's return level.

Other regulations related to the discipline of officials

1. Officials are reprimanded, the wage lift period is lasting for 03 months;Warning, the wage lift period is 06 months.In case the officer is dismissed, the wage lift period is 12 months, and at the same time the public non -business unit is located in the right job position appropriately.

2. Officials disciplined from reprimand to dismissal shall not carry out the planning, training, retraining and appointment within 12 months from the date of the effective disciplinary decision.

3. Officials who are under disciplinary treatment, being investigated, prosecuted and trial are not appointed, seconded, trained, fostered, resolved retirement or resigns.

4. Management officials who have been disciplined by corruption or being condemned by the Court on corruption are not appointed in the management position.

5. Officials are prohibited from practicing or limiting occupational activities for a certain period of time according to the decision of the competent authority, if not disciplined forced, the public non -business unit must be.Arranging officers in other jobs is not related to banned or limited occupational activities.

6. Officials are disciplined, temporarily suspended or compensated, refunded according to the decision of the public non -business unit if they are not satisfactory, they have the right to complain, sue or request the prize.decision according to the law freedom prescribed.

Regulations for officials being examined for penal liability

1. Officials sentenced to imprisonment by the Court without being a suspended sentence or a court sentence for corruption are forced to resign, from the date the court's judgment or decision takes effect legal..

2. The management officer is sentenced by the Court, of course, it will stop holding the position of management, from the date of the judgment or decision of the Court to take legal effect.

Transition regulations

1. Officials recruited before July 1, 2003 have rights and obligations and managed as officials working under indefinite working contracts as prescribed by this Law.Public non -business units are responsible for completing the procedures to ensure the benefits and policies of employment stability, salary regime and other benefits that officials are enjoying.

2. Officials are recruited from July 1, 2003 to the effective date of this Law to continue performing the contract signed with public non -business units, with rights, obligations and managed.According to the provisions of this Law. Sung

3. The Government details this.

Apply the provisions of the Law on Officials to other subjects

The Government stipulates the application of the Law on Officials to those working in non -business units of socio -political organizations, occupations, social organizations, socio -professional organizations, non -business unitspublic, one -member limited liability company owned by the State.

Effective

This law takes effect from January 1, 2012.

Detailed provisions and implementation guidelines

The Government details and guides the implementation of articles and items assigned in this Law;guide the implementation of other necessary contents of this Law to meet the requirements of state management.

This law was approved by the National Assembly of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, the 8th session on November 15, 2010.



National Assembly Chairman Nguyen Phu Trong

Scope

This law stipulates legal status and legal standards on the behavior of individuals and legal entities;rights and obligations of personal identity and property of individuals and legal entities in relationships formed on the basis of equality, freedom of will, independence of property and self -responsibility (hereinafter collectively referred to as collectively.civil relations).

Recognize, respect, protect and ensure civil rights

1. In the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, civil rights are recognized, respected, protected and guaranteed by the Constitution and the law.

2. Civil rights can only be restricted in accordance with the law in case of necessity for national defense, national security, social order and safety, social ethics, and health of the community..

Basic principles of civil law

1. All individuals and legal entities are equal, not to take any reason to discriminate;The law is equally protected about personal rights and property.

2. Individuals and legal entities establish, implement, end their civil rights and obligations on the basis of freedom, voluntary commitment and agreement.All commitments and agreements do not violate the prohibition of the law, not contrary to the effective social ethics to implement for the parties and must be respected by other subjects.

3. Individuals and legal entities must establish, implement and terminate their civil rights and obligations in a good and honest manner.

4. The establishment, implementation, end of civil rights and obligations must not infringe on national interests, ethnicity, public interests, legitimate rights and interests of others.

5. Individuals and legal entities must take responsibility for themselves not to perform or perform incorrectly civil obligations.

Applying the Civil Code

1. This law is the common law to regulate civil relations.

2. Other laws related to regulating civil relations in specific areas are not contrary to the basic principles of civil law prescribed in Article 3 of this Code.

3. In case of other relevant laws that are not prescribed or prescribed but violated Clause 2 of this Article, the provisions of this Code shall be applied.

4. In case there is a difference between the provisions of this Code and the international treaty that the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a member of the same issue, the provisions of the international treaty.

Application of practices

1. Collection is a rules that have clear content to determine the rights and obligations of individuals and legal entities in specific civil relations, formed and repeated many times for a long time., acknowledged and widely applied in a region, region, ethnicity, community or in a civil field.

2. In case the parties do not have an agreement and the law does not specify, it may apply the custom but the practices are not contrary to the basic principles of the civil law prescribed in Article 3 of the Code.This.

Apply similar to the law

1. In case of arising relations within the scope of the civil law that the parties do not have agreements, the law does not have regulations and there is no practices applied, the provisions of the law are adjusted.Similar civil relationship.

2. In case of not being applicable to the law as prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article, the basic principles of civil law prescribed in Article 3 of this Code, the case and fairness.

State policies for civil relations

1. The establishment, implementation, ending civil rights and obligations must ensure preserving the national identity, respect and promote customs, practices, good traditions, solidarity, solidarity, and solidarity,Tuong Ai, each person for the community, the community for each person and the beautiful ethical values ​​of the peoples living in Vietnam.

2. In civil relations, the conciliation among the parties in accordance with the law is encouraged.

Basis for establishing civil rights

Civil rights are established from the following bases:

1. Contract.

2. Unilateral legal acts.

3. Decisions of the Court and other competent agencies as prescribed by the Law.

4. Results of labor, production and business;The results of creative activity produce intellectual property rights.

5. possessing property.

6. Using property, beneficial to property without legal basis.

7. Damaged by illegal acts.

8. Performing without authorization.

9. Other bases prescribed by law.

Exercise civil rights

1. Individuals and legal entities exercise civil rights in their will, not contrary to the provisions of Article 3 and Article 10 of this Code.

2. Individuals and legal entities do not exercise their civil rights are not the basis for ending the rights, unless otherwise provided for by the Law.

Limit the exercise of civil rights

1. Individuals and legal entities must not abuse their civil rights, causing damage to others, to violate their obligations or to perform other purposes against law.

2. In cases where individuals and legal entities do not comply with Clause 1 of this Article, the Court or other competent authorities shall base on the nature and consequences of violations that may not be partially protected.Or all their rights, compensation for damage and may apply other sanctions prescribed by the law.

Methods of protecting civil rights

When the civil rights of individuals and legal entities are violated, the subject has the right to protect themselves in accordance with this Code, other relevant laws or request competent agencies and organizations:

1. Recognize, respect, protect and ensure your civil rights.

2. Forced to terminate violations.

3. Forced apology, publicization.

4. Forced obligations.

5. Forced compensation for damage.

6. Cancellation of illegal decisions of agencies, organizations and competent people.

7. Other requirements as prescribed by the Law.

Self -defense civil rights

The self -defense of civil rights must be consistent with the nature and extent of infringing upon such civil rights and not contrary to the basic principles of civil law prescribed in Article 3 of this Code.

Damages

Individuals and legal entities with civil rights are infringed upon compensation for all damage, unless otherwise agreed or otherwise provided.

Protect civil rights through competent agencies

1. Courts and other competent agencies are responsible for respect and protection of civil rights of individuals and legal entities.

In case civil rights are infringed or disputed, the protection of the right to comply with the procedural law in the Court or arbitration.

The protection of civil rights according to administrative procedures is implemented in case the law prescribed.The decision to settle the case according to administrative procedures may be reviewed at the Court.

2. The Court is not allowed to refuse to settle the case or civil affairs for the reasons of not having the law to apply;In this case, the provisions of Articles 5 and 6 of this Code are applied.

Cancel illegal decisions of agencies, organizations and competent people

When resolving the requirements of protecting civil rights, the Court or other competent agencies have the right to cancel the illegal decision of the competent agencies, organizations and persons.

In case of an individual decision, the civil rights are infringed upon and may be protected by the methods prescribed in Article 11 of this Code.

Individual's civil law capacity

1. Individual civil legal capacity is the individual's ability with civil rights and civil obligations.

2. All individuals have the same civil legal capacity.

3. The civil law capacity of the individual dates from when he was born and ended when he died.

Content of the individual's civil legal capacity

1. Personal rights are not associated with property and personal rights associated with property.

2. Ownership, inheritance rights and other rights for property.

3. The right to participate in civil relations and are obliged to arise from that relationship.

There is no limitation of the individual's civil legal capacity

The civil legal capacity of individuals is not restricted, unless otherwise provided for by other laws.

Individual's civil act capacity

The individual's civil act capacity is the individual's ability by establishing, exercising civil rights and obligations.

1. Adults are people from eighteen years of age or older.

2. The minor has adequate civil act capacity, except for cases specified in Articles 22, 23 and 24 of this Code.

Minors

1. Adult people are not eighteen years old.

2. Civil transactions of a person who are not six years old are established and implemented by the person's legal representative.

3. People from six years old to less than fifteen years of age when establishing and making civil transactions must be agreed by the legal representative, except for civil transactions to serve the daily needs of daily living in accordance withages.

4. People from fifteen years old to less than eighteen years old set up, conduct civil transactions, except for civil transactions related to real estate, real estate must register and other civil transactions according toThe provisions of the Law must be agreed by the legal representative.

Loss of civil act capacity

1. When a person has a mental illness or other illness that cannot be perceived or mastered the behavior, according to the request of the person with the rights, the interests of the relevant or the relevant agency or organization, the CourtDecision declaration of this person who loses civil act capacity on the basis of concluding mental forensic examination.

When there is no basis to declare a person who has lost civil act capacity, at the request of the person or the person with the rights, the interests of the relevant or the relevant agency, the Court, the Court issues a decision to cancelLeaving the decision to declare the loss of civil act capacity.

2. Civil transactions of people who have lost civil act capacity must be established and implemented by legal representatives.

People with difficulties in awareness and control of behavior

1. Adolescents due to physical or mental status without being able to perceive and master behavior but not to the extent of losing civil act capacity, at the request of this person, the person with rights and interestsRelevant or of relevant agencies, organizations, on the basis of conclusions of psychiatric examination, the Court issues a decision to declare this person who has difficulties in awareness, behavior and appointment of people.guardian, determining the rights and obligations of the guardian.

2. When there is no basis to declare a person with difficulties in awareness and control of behavior, at the request of that person or person with the rights, relevant interests or agencies, relevant organizations,The Court issued a decision to cancel the decision to declare that people with difficulties in awareness and behavior.

Limit civil act capacity

1. Drug addicts, addicts of other stimulants leading to the destruction of the family's property, according to the requirements of the person with the rights and interests of the relevant or the relevant agencies, organizations, the Court may come out.The decision to declare this person is a person with limited civil act capacity.

The Court decides the legal representative of the person with limited civil act capacity and the scope of representative.

2. The establishment and implementation of civil transactions related to the property of the person who is declared to restrict civil act capacity must have the consent of the legal representative, except for the transaction in order to submit toDaily daily needs or other relevant laws.

3. When there is no basis to declare a person who is limited in civil act capacity, at the request of that person or person with the rights, interests or relevant agencies, organizations, CourtsMake decisions to cancel the decision to declare limiting civil act capacity.

Human rights

1. Personal rights prescribed in this Code are civil rights associated with each individual, cannot be transferred to others, unless other laws are relevant to other regulations.

2. The establishment and implementation of civil relations related to the personal rights of minors, people who lose civil act capacity, people with difficulties in awareness and control of behavior must be represented by the representative.According to the law of this person agreed in accordance with this Code, the law is relevant or according to the Court's decision.

The establishment and implementation of civil relations related to the personal rights of the person who is declared missing, the dead must have the consent of his husband, husband or child;In case of no these people, the consent of the father and mother of the person who is declared missing, the dead, except for this Code or other relevant laws.

1. Individuals have the right to have full names (including buffer, if any).Full name of a person is determined by the name of that person's birth.

2. The individual's surname is identified as the father of the father or surname of the mother according to the parental agreement;If there is no agreement, their surname will be determined according to the custom.In case the father has not been identified, his surname is determined according to the surname of the mother.

In case children are abandoned, have not yet identified their biological father and mother, and adopted as a child's surname is determined according to the adoptive father or their adoptive mother according to the agreement of the adoptive parents.In case only adoptive father or adoptive mother, the family of children is determined by their surname.

In case children are abandoned, have not yet identified their biological father, mother and have not been adopted, the family of children is determined at the request of the head of that nurturing establishment or at the request.of a person who requires birth registration for children, if children are temporarily nurtured by that person.

The father and mother are stipulated in this Code as a father and mother determined based on the birth event;Those who ask for surrogacy with people born from surrogacy in accordance with the Law on Marriage and Family.

3. The naming is limited in case of infringing upon the legitimate rights and interests of others or contrary to the basic principles of civil law prescribed in Article 3 of this Code.

The name of Vietnamese citizens must be in Vietnamese or other ethnic languages ​​of Vietnam;Do not name by number, with a character that is not the word.

4. Individuals establishing and exercising civil rights and obligations according to their full name and name.

5. The use of alias and pseudonyms must not cause damage to the legitimate rights and interests of others.

Right to identify and redefine ethnicity

1. Individuals have the right to identify and redefine their people.

2. Individuals who are born to identify ethnic groups according to the nation of the father and mother.In case the father or mother belongs to two different ethnic groups, the ethnic group of children is determined by the nation of the father or mother according to the agreement of the father and mother;In case there is no agreement, the ethnicity of the child is determined by the custom;In case of different practices, your ethnic group is determined according to the practices of the nation less.

In case children are abandoned, have not yet identified their biological father and mother and adopted, they are determined by the nation of the adopted father or adopted mother according to the agreement of the adoptive parents.In case only adoptive father or adoptive mother, the ethnic group of children is determined by the ethnicity of that person.

In case children are abandoned, have not yet identified their biological father, mother and have not been adopted, they are determined at the request of the head of that nurturing establishment or at the request of the person.temporarily nurturing children at the time of birth registration for children.

3. Individuals have the right to request a competent state agency to redefine the nation in the following case:

a) Reassemble according to the ethnic group of the father or mother in case the father or mother belongs to two different ethnic groups;

b) Redefine according to the ethnic group of the father or mother in case the adopted child has identified his father or mother.

4. The re -identification of ethnic groups for people from fifteen years to under eighteen years of age must be agreed by that person.

5. Prohibit the re -determination of ethnicity for profit or division, harmful to the solidarity of Vietnamese peoples.

The right to be born, death

1. Individuals from birth have the right to be born.

2. Individuals who die must be killed.

Right for nationality

1. Individuals have the right to have nationality.

2. The determination, change, import, stop, return to Vietnamese nationality prescribed by the Law on Vietnamese Nationality.

3. Rights of non -national residents, living in the territory of Vietnam are guaranteed by law.

Personal rights for images

1. Individuals have the right to their image.

The use of an individual's image must be agreed by that person.

The use of other people's images for commercial purposes must take remuneration for people with images, unless otherwise agreed.

2. The use of images in the following case does not need the consent of the person with the image or the legal representative of them:

a) The image is used for national, ethnic and public interests;

b) Images used from public activities, including conferences, seminars, sports competitions, art performances and other public activities without damaging honor and dignity., the reputation of the person with the image.

3. The use of images that violate the provisions of this Article, the person who has the image has the right to request the Court to issue a decision to force the violator, the agency, organization and individual to be recovered and spent.Canceling and terminating the use of images, compensation for damage and applying other handling measures as prescribed by law.

The right to live, the right to ensure safety of life, health, body

1. Individuals who have the right to live, inviolable rights about their lives, body and rights to be protected on health.No one is deprived of illegal life.

2. When detecting an accident or illness that is threatened with life, the discovery person is responsible or requires individuals, agencies and other organizations to immediately take them to the medical examination and medical facility immediately.the nearest place to treat;Medical examination and treatment establishments are responsible for performing medical examination and treatment in accordance with the law on medical examination and treatment.

3. Anesthesia, surgery, removal, tissue transplantation, human body;implementing new techniques and methods of medical examination and treatment on the human body;Medical, pharmacy, science or any other test form on the human body must be consent of that person and must be implemented by competent authorities.

a) Having the consent of that person before dying;

b) Having the consent of parents, spouses, adults or guardians if they do not have the person's opinion before dying;

c) According to the decision of the head of the medical examination and treatment establishment or the competent state agency in case the law is prescribed.

The right to be protected with honor, dignity, prestige

1. Honor, dignity and reputation of individuals are inviolable and protected by law.

2. Individuals have the right to request the Court to reject information adversely affecting their honor, dignity and reputation.

The protection of honor, dignity and prestige can be done after the individual dies at the request of a minor husband, husband or child;In case of not these people, at the request of the father and mother of the dead, unless other laws have other regulations.

3. Information adversely affecting the honor, dignity and reputation of individuals posted on any mass media must be removed and corrected by that mass media.If this information is stored by agencies, organizations and individuals, it must be canceled.

4. In case of failure to identify the person who has reported bad effects on his honor, dignity and reputation, the person who is reported to have the right to request the Court to declare that information is not true.

5. Individuals who are informed adversely affect the honor, dignity and prestige, in addition to the right to refuse that information, also has the right to ask the person to give an apology, public improvement and compensation.damages.

The right to donate, receive human tissue, body parts and donate, take corpses

1. Individuals who have the right to donate tissue and body parts when they are still alive or donate tissue, body parts, donation of their corpses after dying for the purpose of healing for others or medical research, pharmacyand other scientific studies.

2. Individuals have the right to receive tissue and body parts of others to cure themselves.Medical examination and treatment establishments, legal entities competent in scientific research have the right to receive human body parts, take corpses for healing, medical tests, pharmacy and other scientific studies.

3. The donation, tissue, part of the human body, donation and taking the body must comply with the conditions and comply with the provisions of this Code, the Law on Donation, taking, transplanting the tissue, the body part of the human bodyand donated, taking corpses and other relevant laws.

Red identification of gender

1. Individuals have the right to redefine gender.

The redefining of a person's gender is performed in the case of a person's gender with birth defects or not accurately shaped but requires medical intervention in order to clearly define gender.

2. Reassembling gender shall comply with the provisions of law.

3. Individuals who have re -determined gender have the rights and obligations to register civil status changes in accordance with the law on civil status;Having a personal right in accordance with gender has been redefined in accordance with this Code and other relevant laws.

Gender conversion

Gender conversion shall comply with the law.Individuals who have transformed sex have the rights and obligations to register civil status changes in accordance with the law on civil status;Having personal rights in accordance with gender has been converted in accordance with this Code and other relevant laws.

Rights on private life, personal secrets, family secrets

1. Private life, personal secrets, family secrets are inviolable and protected by law.

2. The collection, storage, use and disclosure of information related to private life, personal secrets must be agreed by that person, collecting, storing, using and publicizing contact informationRegarding family secrets must be agreed by family members, unless otherwise provided for by law.

3. Mail, telephone, telephone, electronic database and other personal information exchange forms of individuals are guaranteed safety and secret.

The openness, control and seizure of correspondence, telephone, telephone, electronic database and other types of private information exchange of other people are only implemented in case the law prescribed.

4. The parties in the contract must not disclose information about each other's private life, personal and family secrets that they have known in the process of establishing, performing contracts, except for cases where there isOther agreements.

Personal rights in marriage and family

1. Individuals who have the right to get married, divorce, equality of husband and wife, the right to identify fathers, children, children, the right to adopted, adopted children and other personal rights in marriage relationship, parent and child relationship and relationship between family members.

The child was born regardless of the marriage status of the father and mother all have the same rights and obligations to his father and mother.

2. Individuals who exercise personal rights in marriage and family according to the provisions of this Code, the Law on Marriage and Family and other laws are related.

Personal residence

1. The place of individual residence is the place where the person often lives.

2. In case of failure to determine the residence of the individual as prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article, the residence of the individual is the place where that person is living.

3. In case one side of civil relations changes the residence associated with the exercise of rights and obligations, the other party must notify the new residence.

The residence of the minor

1. The residence of minors is the residence of parents;If the father and mother have a different residence, the residence of minors is the residence of a father or mother whose minors often live together.

2. Military people may have a different residence from the residence of their fathers and mothers if they are agreed by their parents or laws.

The residence of the guardian

1. The residence of the guardian is the residence of the guardian.

2. The guardian may have a different residence from the guardian of the guardian if the guardian agrees or the law has stipulated.

Husband and wife's residence

1. The residence of the husband and wife is the place where the husband and wife often live together.

2. Husband and wife may have different residents if agreed.

The residence of the soldier

1. The residence of the soldier is performing military service is the place where the soldier's unit is stationed.

2. The residence of military officers, professional soldiers, workers and defense officers is where the person's unit is stationed, unless they have a place of residence as prescribed in Clause 1, Article 40 ofThis law.

The residence of the mobile person

The residence of mobile people working on ship, boats, other mobile practicing vehicles is the place where ships, boats and vehicles, unless they have a place of residence as prescribed in Clause 1, Article 40 ofThis law.

Guardian

Guardians are individuals and legal entities prescribed by the law, appointed by the commune -level People's Committee, appointed by the Court or prescribed in Clause 2, Article 48 of this Code (hereinafter collectively referred to as the personguardians) to take care of and protect the legitimate rights and interests of minors, people who lose civil act capacity, people with difficulties in awareness and control of behavior (hereinafter collectively calling jointis the guardian).

2. In case the guardian for people with difficulties in awareness and control of behavior must be agreed by that person if they have the ability to express their will at the time of request.

The guardian of course without registering the guardian must still fulfill the obligations of the guardian.

Guardian

1. Individuals and legal entities who are eligible for this Code shall be served as guardians.

2. In case a person with a full civil act capacity chooses a guardian for himself, when they are in the situation that needs a guardian, individual and legal entity selected as a guardian if this person agrees.The selection of guardians must be made in a notarized or authenticated document.

3. An individual, legal entity may guard many people.

Conditions of individuals as guardians

Individuals who have the following conditions can be a guardian:

1. Having adequate civil act capacity.

2. Having good moral status and necessary conditions to exercise the rights and obligations of the guardian.

3. It is not the person who is being examined for penal liability or the convicted person but has not been deleted with the crime of one of the crimes of intentionally infringing upon the life, health, honor, dignity and property of people.other.

Conditions of legal entities as guardians

The legal entity has the following conditions that can be a guardian:

1. Having civil legal capacity suitable to the guardian.

2. Having necessary conditions to exercise the rights and obligations of the guardian.

The relatives of the guardian are the spouse, father, mother, and child of the guardian;If no one of these people, the relatives of the guardian are grandparents, grandparents, siblings, siblings, younger sisters of the guardian;If there are no one of these people, the relatives of the guardian are uncle, uncle, uncle, biological, aunt, and aunt of the guardian.

3. The supervisor of the guardian must be a person with adequate civil act capacity if it is an individual and a civil legal capacity suitable to the supervision if it is a legal entity;have the necessary conditions to perform the monitoring.

a) Monitor and inspect the guardian in the implementation of the guardian;

Commercial legal entity

1. Commercial legal entity is a legal entity with the main goal of seeking profits and profits divided by members.

2. Commercial legal entities include enterprises and other economic organizations.

3. The establishment, operation and termination of commercial legal entities shall comply with the provisions of this Code, the Enterprise Law and other relevant laws.

Non -commercial legal entity

1. Non -commercial legal entity is a legal entity that does not have the main goal of seeking profits;If there is a profit, it is not divided by members.

2. Non -commercial legal entity includes state agencies, people's armed forces, political organizations, socio -political organizations, socio -political organizations, occupations, social organizations, groups, groups, groupsSocial - professional, social funds, charity funds, social enterprises and other non -commercial organizations.

3. The establishment, operation and termination of non -commercial legal entities shall comply with the provisions of this Code, the laws on the organizational structure of the state apparatus and other relevant laws.

The name of the legal entity

1. The legal entity must have a name in Vietnamese.

2. The name of the legal entity must clearly show the type of organization of the legal entity and distinguish it from other legal entities in the same field of activity.

3. Legal entities must use their name in civil transactions.

4. The name of legal entity is recognized and protected by law.

Headquarters of legal entities

1. The headquarters of the legal entity is the place where the executive agency of the legal entity.In case of changing the headquarters, the legal entity must be publicly announced.

2. The contact address of the legal entity is the headquarters of the legal entity.Legal people can choose other places as contacts.

Nationality of legal entities

The legal entity established under Vietnamese law is Vietnamese legal entity.

Property of legal entities

The assets of legal entities include capital contributed by the owner, founder, members of the legal entity and other property that the legal entity may establish ownership in accordance with this Code, other laws are related.

Establishment, registration of legal entities

1. Legal entities are established under an initiative of individuals, legal entities or decisions of competent state agencies.

2. Registration of legal entities includes registration of establishment, registration of changes and other registration according to the provisions of law.

3. The registration of legal entities must be publicly announced.

Organizational structure of legal entities

1. The legal entity must have an administration agency.The organization, duties and powers of the executive agency of the legal entity are specified in the charter of the legal entity or in the decision to establish the legal entity.

2. The legal entity has other agencies according to the decision of the legal entity or in accordance with the law.

Branches, representative offices of legal entities

1. Branches and representative offices are dependent units of legal entities, not legal entities.

2. The branch is responsible for fulfilling the entire or part of the legal function.

3. Representative office is responsible for representing the scope assigned by the legal entity, protecting the interests of the legal entity.

4. The establishment and termination of branches and representative offices of legal entities must be registered in accordance with the law and publicly announced.

5. The head of the branch or representative office performs the tasks according to the authorization of the legal entity within the scope and the authorized term.

6. The legal entity has civil rights and obligations arising from civil transactions established by branches and representative offices.

Representative of legal entities

Representatives of legal entities may be legal representatives or authorized representatives.The representative of the legal entity must comply with the representative regulations at Chapter IX this section.

Civil legal capacity of legal entities

1. Civil law capacity of legal entities is the ability of legal entities with civil rights and obligations.The civil legal capacity of legal entities is not limited, unless otherwise provided for by other laws.

2. Civil legal capacity of legal entities arising from the time of being established or allowed to establish;If the legal entity must register for operation, the civil legal capacity of the legal entity arises from the time of the registration book.

3. The civil legal capacity of legal entities ends from the time of termination of legal entities.

Civil liability of legal entities

1. The legal entity must take civil responsibility for the exercise of civil rights and obligations established by the representative and perform on behalf of the legal entity.

The legal entity responsible for the obligations was established by the founder or the founder of the founder, to establish and register the legal entity, unless otherwise agreed or otherwise provided.

2. The legal entity is responsible for civilians with their property;Not responsible for the legal entity of the legal obligations established by the legal entity of the legal entity, the implementation of the legal entity, unless otherwise provided for by the Law.

3. People of legal entities are not responsible for civilians instead of legal entities for civil obligations established and implemented by legal entities, unless otherwise provided for by the Law.

Merse of legal entities

1. The legal entities can merge into a new legal entity.

2. After merging, the former legal entities ended from the time of the newly established legal entity;Civil rights and obligations of former legal entities are transferred to new legal entities.

Merging legal entities

1. A legal entity may be merged (hereinafter referred to as a merged legal entity) into another legal entity (hereinafter referred to as merged legal entity).

2. After the merger, the merged legal entity terminates;The civil rights and obligations of the merged legal entity are transferred to the merger legal entity.

Divide the legal entity

1. A legal entity can be divided into many legal entities.

2. After the division, the legal entity is divided into existence;The civil rights and obligations of the divided legal entity were transferred to new legal entities.

Separate legal entities

1. A legal entity can be separated into many legal entities.

2. After separation, legal entities are separated and legal entities that are separated to exercise their rights and civil obligations in accordance with their operational purposes.

Convert the form of legal entities

1. The legal entity may be converted into other legal entities.

2. After converting the form, the transformation of the conversion terminates from the time the legal entity is established;The legal entity converts inheritance and civil obligations of the legal entity.

Payment of assets of legal entities dissolved

1. Property of dissolved legal entity is paid in the following order:

a) Cost of dissolution of legal entities;

b) Salary debts, severance allowances, social insurance, health insurance for workers in accordance with the law and other benefits of workers under the collective and collective labor agreement.The contract has been signed;

c) Tax debt and other debts.

2. After paying all the cost of dissolution of legal entities and debts, the rest belongs to the owner of the legal entity, the members contributing capital, except for the case specified in Clause 3 of this Article or the law yesother rule.

3. In case the social fund and charity fund have paid off the dissolution costs and the debts specified in Clause 1 of this Article, the remaining assets are transferred to other funds with the same purpose of operation.

In case there is no other fund that has the same purpose of receiving transfer assets or the fund is dissolved due to violations of the prohibition of the law or contrary to social morality, the asset of the dissolved fund belongs to the state.

Bankruptcy of legal entities

Bankruptcy of legal entities comply with the law on bankruptcy.

Termination of legal existence

1. Termination legal entity exists in the following case:

a) Consolidation, merger, division, form of formal and dissolution of legal entities as prescribed in Articles 88, 89, 90, 92 and 93 of this Code;

b) Being declared bankrupt in accordance with the law on bankruptcy.

2. Termination of legal entities exist from the time of deleting the name in the legal entity registration book or from the time of determined in the decision of the competent state agency.

3. When the legal entity terminates the existence, the property of the legal entity shall be settled in accordance with this Code, the other provisions of the relevant law.

The State of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, the central state agency, in the locality in civil relations

The State of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, the central state agency, in the locality when participating in civil relations is equal to other entities and is civil responsibility as prescribed in Article 99 andArticle 100 of this Code.

3. The State of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, the central and local state agencies are not responsible for the civil obligations of the legal entity established by the legal entity, including the state -owned enterprise, except forIn case the State of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, the central state agency and local authorities guarantee the civil obligations of this legal entity in accordance with the law.

4. The central and local state agencies are not responsible for the civil obligations of the State of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, other state agencies at the central and local levels, except for cases.Related laws have other regulations.

The subject in civil relations has the participation of households, cooperative groups, and other organizations without legal status

Common property of household members, cooperative groups, other organizations without legal status

Trách nhiệm dân sự của thành viên hộ gia đình, tổ hợp tác, tổ chức khác không có tư cách pháp nhân

1. Nghĩa vụ dân sự phát sinh từ việc tham gia quan hệ dân sự của hộ gia đình, tổ hợp tác, tổ chức khác không có tư cách pháp nhân được bảo đảm thực hiện bằng tài sản chung của các thành viên.

2. Trường hợp các thành viên không có hoặc không đủ tài sản chung để thực hiện nghĩa vụ chung thì người có quyền có thể yêu cầu các thành viên thực hiện nghĩa vụ theo quy định tại Điều 288 của Bộ luật này.

3. Trường hợp các bên không có thỏa thuận, hợp đồng hợp tác hoặc luật không có quy định khác thì các thành viên chịu trách nhiệm dân sự quy định tại khoản 1 và khoản 2 Điều này theo phần tương ứng với phần đóng góp tài sản của mình, nếu không xác định được theo phần tương ứng thì xác định theo phần bằng nhau.

Legal consequences for civil transactions because members do not have the right to represent or exceed the scope of establishment and implementation

1.
